p: Safety. Although gastrointestinal reactions ( EMA, 2015a) and nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea have been listed among the symptoms of overdose ( Bisset, 1994), and although there might be allergic reactions to the saponins, H. helix preparations are generally considered to be safe. There was a minimal report of adverse effects in 10 clinical trials, including three controlled trials (one of which was placebo-controlled) and 7 non-randomized observational studies ( Holzinger and Chenot, 2011). Overall, the safety is High, and there are no reports to infer that the preparations from the plant may interfere negatively with the disease or NSAIDs.
